series: Revue des Nouvelles Technologies de l'Information
title: Evaluating Bayesian Networks by Sampling with Simplified Assumptions
abstract: The most common fitness evaluation for Bayesian networks in the presence of data is the Cooper-Herskovitz criterion. This technique involves massive amounts of data and, therefore, expansive computations. We propose a cheaper alternative evaluation method using simplified ssumptions which produces evaluations that are strongly correlated with the Cooper-Herskovitz criterion.
